physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Systolic murmur, subtle angioid streak in the left eye, drusenlike bodies in both fundi, skin biopsy showing calcification and fragmentation of elastic fibers in the mid and deep dermis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At follow-up 13 years later, stable ocular findings; no skin lesions; no visual, cardiovascular, or gastrointestinal symptoms.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Faint yellowish macules and papules on neck and axillae, skin biopsy showing basophilic granular alteration of elastic fibers.
Loose wrinkled skin with yellow discoloration on neck and axillae, angioid streaks on funduscopic examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Seven years later, solitary angioid streak of the left fundus and faint yellow papules on neck found.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Skin examination revealed yellow papules of the lower neck, otherwise unremarkable examination including peripheral pulses.
